description: Two spiders are depicted on their web, part of which is torn with wavy lines indicating a struggle or escape. One spider offers comfort to the other, likening the loss of prey to the human experience of having a significant missed opportunity or romantic partner who "got away." This applies a common idiom about regret over lost chances to the absurd context of arachnid predation.
caption: "Don't take it so hard. ... Everyone's got a story about the one that got away."
